column4: I tried to install python 2.6, and something went wrong. The mouse keeps going out of control, Exail and Emesene don't start.. The update manager is acting weird. Please help me.
uninstall it?
the problem is, it doesn't even appear to have been installed.
type python --version

I'm trying to get the output for "python --version", but it takes some time get it. Now, if press ctrl-c during that and try "python --version" again it does give me the completely output instantly, but then it takes the mouse away from me, in a way that my clicks are no more effective, I can no longer do anything at all but moving the cursor or hitting ctrl-alt-back space on the keyboard.
open up Synaptic and search for python, if you see that 2.6, uninstall it
I tried that, moments ago. Python 2.6 doesn't even exist there.
don't know what to tell you really, sorry
I'm trying installing python-all. Maybe this might help.
Isn't it weird that Ubuntu supports Python 3.0, but doesn't seem to support Python 2.6?
yeah i noticed that when you started talking about it, i looked it up, 2.5 and 3.0 in repos but no 2.6
2.5 is all you need right now
Could it be because 3.0 is more mature?
not sure
That's true. I've learned my lesson. :)
For some reason, the mouse keeps going out of control. It keeps taking the shape of a plus sign ( + ).
that's weird, just from installing 2.6? which has nothing to do with graphics or mice
have you tried restrting X?
How do I do that?
I tried that many times.
Is there a way to regain control over it from the terminal?
